an4.102:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of clouds.
an4.102:1.5: one neither thunders nor rains, and
an4.102:1.7: These are the four kinds of clouds.
an4.102:1.8: In the same way, these four individuals similar to clouds are found in the world.
an4.102:1.12: one neither thunders nor rains, and
an4.102:2.1: And how does an individual thunder but not rain?
an4.102:2.2: It’s when an individual memorizes the teaching—
an4.102:2.3: statements, mixed prose and verse, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and elaborations.
an4.102:2.4: But they don’t truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.102:2.5: That’s how an individual thunders but doesn’t rain.
an4.102:2.6: That individual is like a cloud that thunders but doesn’t rain, I say.
an4.102:3.1: And how does an individual rain but not thunder?
an4.102:3.2: It’s when an individual doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.102:3.4: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.102:4.1: And how does an individual neither thunder nor rain?
an4.102:4.2: It’s when an individual doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.102:4.4: Nor do they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.102:5.1: And how does an individual both thunder and rain?
an4.102:5.2: It’s when an individual memorizes the teaching …
an4.102:5.4: And they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.102:5.8: These four individuals similar to clouds are found in the world.”
